{{senseid|en|Q283}}{{lb|en|uncountable}} A substance (of molecular formula H2O) found at room temperature and pressure as a clear [[liquid]]; it is present naturally as [[rain]], and found in [[river]]s, [[lake]]s and [[sea]]s; its solid form is [[ice]] and its gaseous form is [[steam]]. #: {{ux|en|By the action of electricity, the '''water''' was resolved into its two parts, oxygen and hydrogen.}} #* {{quote-journal|en|year=2013|month=September-October|author=[http://www.americanscientist.org/authors/detail/katie-l-burke Katie L. Burke]| magazine={{w|American Scientist}}| title=[http://www.americanscientist.org/issues/pub/2013/5/in-the-news-47 In the News]| passage=Oxygen levels on Earth skyrocketed 2.4 billion years ago, when cyanobacteria evolved photosynthesis: the ability to convert '''water''' and carbon dioxide into carbohydrates and waste oxygen using solar energy.}} ## {{lb|en|uncountable|in particular}} The liquid form of this substance: liquid H2O. ##: {{ux|en|May I have a glass of '''water'''?}} ##: {{ux|en|Your plants need more '''water'''.}} ##* '''1835''', Sir {{w|John Ross (Arctic explorer)|John Ross}}, Sir {{w|James Clark Ross}}, ''[http://books.google.com.au/books?id=SdQBAAAAYAAJ Narrative of a Second Voyage in Search of a North-west Passage …, Volume 1]'', pp.284-5 ##*: Towards the following morning, the thermometer fell to 5°; and at daylight, there was not an atom of '''water''' to be seen in any direction. ##* '''2002''', Arthur T. Hubbard, ''Encyclopedia of Surface and Colloid Science'' {{ISBN|0824707966}}, page 4895: ##*: A '''water''' drop placed on the surface of ice can either spread or form a lens depending on the properties of the three phases involved in wetting, i.e., on the properties of the ice, '''water''', and gas phases. ##* {{quote-journal|en|date=2013-05-11|volume=407|issue=8835|page=80|magazine={{w|The Economist}}| title=[http://www.economist.com/news/science-and-technology/21577341-worlds-third-largest-area-ice-about-undergo-systematic The climate of Tibet: Pole-land]| passage=Of all the transitions brought about on the Earth’s surface by temperature change, the melting of ice into '''water''' is the starkest. wikitext.*:
{{also|vorba}}

==Romanian==

===Etymology===
Maybe from {{inh|ro|la|verbum||word}}<ref>Ciorănescu, Alexandru (1966), "vorbă" in ''Dicționarul etimologic român'', San Cristóbal de La Laguna: University of La Laguna</ref> through ''*vărbu'', subsequently ''*vărbă'' by singularization of the supplanted neuter plural up to {{m|ro|vorbă}} in analogy to the change from [ə] to [o] in the imperative {{m|ro|vino}} from {{m|ro|vină}}. The intermediate form ''*vărbu'' is strengthened by related Aromanian {{m|rup|vãrghescu||to quarrel, scold, urge}}, having turned [b] into [g] which is a common trait. For instance, in the singular {{m|rup|corbu}} and in the plural {{m|rup|corghi}}.

Conversely, it might have come from {{bor|ro|sla-pro|*dvorьba}}, from {{m|sla-pro|*dvorъ||court}}, as sustained by the presupposed variant {{m|ro|horbă||gathering, word}}.<ref>Ciorănescu, Alexandru (1966), "vorbă" in ''Dicționarul etimologic român'', San Cristóbal de La Laguna: University of La Laguna</ref> In the 17th century it still had the meaning of "gathering", attested by [[w:Dosoftei|Dosoftei Bărilă]], but already by 1744, as attested by [[w:Ion Neculce|Ion Neculce]], it seems to have shifted to "word" in case this meaning was not already encompassed previously. Moreover, in old texts, a word {{m|ro|dvorbă}}, presumably of this etymology, meant "service to the court", and was never confused with {{m|ro||vorbă}}.<ref>Ciorănescu, Alexandru (1966), "vorbă" in ''Dicționarul etimologic român'', San Cristóbal de La Laguna: University of La Laguna</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|ro|[ˈvor.bə]}}
* {{audio|ro|LL-Q7913 (ron)-Filosoful-vorbă.wav|Audio|Audio}}

===Noun===
{{ro-noun|f|vorbe}}

# [[word]]
# [[talk]], [[talking]], [[speaking]]
# [[telling]], [[relation]]
# [[conversation]], [[discussion]]

====Declension====
{{ro-noun-f-ă|vorb}}

====Synonyms====
* {{l|ro|cuvânt}}

====Derived terms====
* {{l|ro|vorbi}}

{{also|áir|-air|'air|air.|àir.}} ==English== {{wikipedia|Air (disambiguation)}} [[File:Atmosphere gas proportions.svg|thumb|The composition of the air.]] ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|en|aire|ayre|eyr||obsolete}} * {{alter|en|ayr||especially when referring to the form of music}} ===Etymology=== {{root|en|ine-pro|*h₂weh₁-}} From {{inh|en|enm|aire}}, from {{der|en|fro|air}}, from {{der|en|la|āēr}}, from {{der|en|grc|ἀήρ}}. Displaced native {{ncog|ang|lyft}}. More at [[lift]], [[loft]]. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|RP}} {{IPA|en|/ɛə/|/ɛː/}} ** {{audio|en|En-uk-air.ogg|Audio (UK)}} * {{a|GenAm}} {{enPR|âr}}, {{IPA|en|/ɛɚ/|/ɛɹ/}} ** {{audio|en|en-us-air.ogg|Audio (US)}} * {{rhymes|en|ɛə(ɹ)|s=1}} * {{homophones|en|Ayr|ere|eyre|heir}}, [[are]] {{q|unit of measurement}}; [[err]] {{qualifier|one pronunciation}}; [[e'er]] (US) ===Noun=== {{en-noun|~}} # {{lb|en|uncountable|meteorology}} The [[substance]] [[constituting]] [[Earth]]'s [[atmosphere]], ''[[particularly]]:'' #: {{ux|en|I'm going outside to get some '''air'''.}} #: {{ux|en|The '''air''' on Mars is so thin that high and low temperatures on the day differ alot.}} ## {{lb|en|historical|philosophy|alchemy}} [[understood]] as [[one]] of the [[four]] [[element]]s of the [[ancient]] [[Greek]]s and [[Roman]]s. ## {{lb|en|historical|medical}} [[understood]] as a [[particular]] [[local]] [[substance]] with [[suppose]]d [[effect]]s on [[human]] [[health]]. ##* '''1991''' May 12, [[w:List of Jeeves and Wooster episodes|"Kidnapped!"]] [[w:Jeeves and Wooster|''Jeeves and Wooster'']], Series 2, Episode 5: ##*: ''Jeeves:'' Foreign travel often liberates emotions best kept in check, sir. The '''air''' of North America is notoriously stimulating in this regard, as witness the regrettable behavior of its inhabitants in 1776.
''B. Wooster:'' Hm? What happened in 1776, Jeeves?
''Jeeves:'' I prefer not to dwell on it, if it's convenient to you, sir. ##: {{ux|en|There was a tension in the '''air''' which made me suspect an approaching storm.}} ## {{lb|en|physics}} [[understood]] as a [[gaseous]] [[mixture]] of [[nitrogen]], [[oxygen]], and [[various]] [[trace]] [[gas]]es. # {{lb|en|usually|with the}} The [[apparently]] [[open]] [[space]] [[above]] the [[ground]] which [[this]] [[substance]] [[fill]]s, {{lb|en|historical}} [[formerly]] [[thought]] to be [[limit]]ed by the [[firmament]] but {{lb|en|meteorology}} [[now]] [[consider]]ed to be [[surround]]ed by the [[near]] [[vacuum]] of [[outer space]]. #: {{ux|en|The flock of birds took to the '''air'''.}} # A [[breeze]]; a gentle [[wind]]. # A [[feeling]] or [[sense]]. #: {{ux|en|to give it an '''air''' of artistry and [[sophistication]]}} #* '''November 2 2014''', Daniel Taylor, "[http://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/nov/02/manchester-city-manchester-united-premier-league-match-report Sergio Agüero strike wins derby for Manchester City against 10-man United]," ''guardian.co.uk'' #*: Smalling’s quick one-two of yellow cards towards the end of the first half had left an '''air''' of inevitability about what would follow and, if anything, it was probably a surprise that City restricted themselves to Sergio Agüero’s goal bearing in mind another of United’s defenders, Marcos Rojo, was taken off on a stretcher early in the second half with a dislocated shoulder. #* '''1900''', {{w|Charles W. Chesnutt}}, ''{{w|The House Behind the Cedars}}'', Chapter I, #*: The girl stooped to pluck a rose, and as she bent over it, her profile was clearly outlined. She held the flower to her face with a long-drawn inhalation, then went up the steps, crossed the piazza, opened the door without knocking, and entered the house with the '''air''' of one thoroughly at home. # A sense of [[poise]], [[graciousness]], or [[quality]]. #* {{RQ:Austen Emma|I|4|text="He is very plain, undoubtedly—remarkably plain:—but that is nothing compared with his entire want of gentility. I had no right to expect much, and I did not expect much; but I had no idea that he could be so very clownish, so totally without '''air'''. I had imagined him, I confess, a degree or two nearer gentility."}} # {{lb|en|usually|in the plural}} [[pretentious|Pretension]]; [[snobby|snobbishness]]; [[pretence]] that one is better than others. #: {{ux|en|putting on '''airs'''}} #* {{quote-book|en|year=1922|author={{w|Ben Travers}}|title={{w|A Cuckoo in the Nest}} |chapter=1|url=http://openlibrary.org/works/OL1521052W |passage=He read the letter aloud. Sophia listened with the studied '''air''' of one for whom, even in these days, a title possessed some surreptitious allurement.}} # {{lb|en|music}} A song, especially a solo; an [[aria]]. #* {{RQ:Austen Pride and Prejudice|18|text="If I," said Mr. Collins, "were so fortunate as to be able to sing, I should have great pleasure, I am sure, in obliging the company with an '''air'''; for I consider music as a very innocent diversion, and perfectly compatible with the profession of a clergyman{{...}}"}} # {{lb|en|informal}} [[nothing|Nothing]]; absence of anything. # {{lb|en|countable|uncountable}} An [[air conditioner]] or the processed air it produces. #: {{ux|en|Could you turn on the '''air'''?}} #: {{ux|en|Hey, did you mean to leave the '''airs''' on all week while you were on vacation?}} # {{lb|en|obsolete|chemistry}} Any specific [[gas]]. # {{lb|en|snowboarding|skateboarding|motor sports}} A jump in which one becomes airborne. # A television or radio signal; {{lb|en|by extension}} [[media]] [[broadcast]]s in general. #* {{quote-book|en|year=1996|title=Selling the Air |author=Thomas Streeter |page= |ISBN=0226777227 |passage=Ernst gave a list of political activists who had been denied access to the air by private broadcasters, and pointed out that "Secretary Hoover's signature in New York sells for $150,000 to $200,000," thus limiting access to the '''air''' on the part of labor unions and other underrepresented groups. }} #* {{quote-book|en|year=2001|title=The Singing of the Dead |author=Dana Stabenow |page=17 |ISBN= 0312209576|passage=Coming to you live once a month, or whenever I feel like broadcasting a little pirate '''air'''.}} #* '''2015''', Gary Andres, ‎Paul Hernnson, ''Lobbying Reconsidered: Politics # [[water]] {{gloss|liquid H<sub>2</sub>O}}<!-- this formatting displays better and it can be more generally used than subscript numbers like "₂", it's also applied in the article https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chemical_formula -->
# {{lb|hu|physics}} [[water]] {{gloss|chemical having the formula H<sub>2</sub>O}}
#: {{syn|hu|dihidrogén-monoxid}}
# [[water]] {{gloss|any body of water, or a specific part of it}}
#* '''1844''', [[w:Sándor Petőfi|Sándor Petőfi]], ''János vitéz'',<sup>[http://mek.oszk.hu/01000/01010/01010.htm]</sup> chapter 4, stanza 1, translated by John Ridland:<sup>[http://www.magyarulbabelben.net/works/hu/Pet%C5%91fi_S%C3%A1ndor-1823/J%C3%A1nos_Vit%C3%A9z_%28teljes%29/en/58450-John_the_Valiant_%28complete%29]</sup>
#*: Mikorra a patak '''vize''' tükörré lett, / Melybe ezer csillag ragyogása nézett: / Jancsi Iluskáék kertje alatt vala; / Maga sem tudta, hogy mikép jutott oda.
#*:: When the brook made a looking glass of its '''water''', / In whose surface a thousand stars were a-glitter, / Johnny was standing at the foot of Nell’s yard; / Though to tell how he'd come to it would have been hard.
# {{lb|hu|dialectal}} [[flood]]
#: {{syn|hu|árvíz}}
# [[drinking water]], [[mineral water]]
#: {{syn|hu|ivóvíz}}
# [[bathwater]]
#: {{syn|hu|fürdővíz}}
# [[sweat]]
#: {{syn|hu|izzadság|veríték|verejték}}
#* '''1939''', {{w|Jenő Rejtő}}, ''A Nevada szelleme'',<sup>[http://mek.oszk.hu/01500/01598/01598.htm#2]</sup> chapter 2:
#*: Ez a férfi csakúgy sugározta magából a durva, nyugati ember kegyetlen erejét és vadságát. Bár folyt a '''víz''' róla, és inge izzadtan tapadt a testéhez, vasegészségében bízva egyetlen hajtásra itta ki a jeges whiskyt.
#*:: This man exuded the cruel strength and ferocity of the rough, Western man. Though he was dripping with '''water''', and his shirt clung to his body with sweat, he drank the icy whisky in one gulp, trusting his iron health.
# {{lb|hu|rare}} [[water]] {{gloss|limpidity and lustre of a precious stone}}

==Swedish==

===Etymology 1===
From {{inh|sv|gmq-osw|træet|trǣet}}, {{m|gmq-osw|træt|trǣt}}, later {{m|gmq-osw|trædh|trǣdh}}, originally the definite form of {{m|gmq-osw|træ|trǣ|t=tree, wood}}, from {{inh|sv|non|tré}}, from {{inh|sv|gem-pro|*trewą|t=tree, wood}}, from pre-Germanic ''*dréu̯om'', thematic e-grade derivative of {{inh|sv|ine-pro|*dóru|gloss=tree}}. {{doublet|sv|trä}}. The form {{m|gmq-osw|trædh}}, {{m|gmq-osw|trädh}} was used still as the definite form in Old Swedish and in the {{w|Gustav Vasa Bible}} (1541), but by the early 18th century, it had split into the indefinite form meaning ”tree”, separate from {{m|sv|trä||wood}}. Hence, the modern definite form is {{m|sv||trädet}}, with the definite ending {{m|sv|-et}} on top of the now fossilized remnant of definite form ''-d''.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|sv|/trɛː(d)/}}
* {{audio|sv|Sv-träd.ogg|audio}}
* {{rhymes|sv|ɛːd|ɛː}}

====Noun====
{{sv-noun|n}}

# {{lb|sv|botany}} [[tree]]
# tree; plant reminiscent of a tree in the sense above, but which is botanically strictly not a "tree".
# {{lb|sv|graph theory}} tree
# {{lb|sv|computing theory}} tree

=====Usage notes=====
* Since {{m|sv||träd}} is sometimes pronounced {{IPAchar|/trɛː/}} (without the final {{IPAchar|/d/}}), it is sometimes treated as a vowel final neuter word like {{m|sv|spö|t=rod}} with the definite singular {{m|sv|trät}}, plural {{m|sv|trän}}, definite plural {{m|sv|träna}}, compare {{m|sv|bröd}}.

==Middle English==

===Alternative forms===
* {{alter|enm|trawthe|treowthe|treuthe|treuþe|trewthe|trowthe|trowþe|truthe}}

===Etymology===
{{inh+|enm|ang|trēowþ}}, {{m|ang|trīewþ}}, from {{inh|enm|gmw-pro|*triuwiþu}}, from {{inh|enm|gem-pro|*triwwiþō}}; euivalent to {{af|enm|trewe|-the|id2=abstract nominal|pos2=abstract nominal suffix}}. 

The final vowel is generalised from Old English oblique cases, while forms in {{IPAchar|/iu̯/}} reflect the influence of {{m|en|trewe}}; the usual vocalism in {{IPAchar|/ɛu̯/|/ɔu̯/}} is due to shortening before the consonant cluster {{IPAchar|/wθ/}} in late Old English.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|enm|/ˈtrɔu̯ð(ə)/|/ˈtrɛu̯ð(ə)/|/ˈtriu̯ð(ə)/|/-θ(ə)/}}
* {{a|Early ME}} {{IPA|enm|/ˈtrøwðə/}}

===Noun===
{{enm-noun|-}}

# [[loyalty]] (to a cause)
# [[honesty]], [[honor]], [[troth]]
# [[goodness]], [[kindness]], [[integrity]]
# [[truth]], [[reality]] (especially absolute)
# [[religion]], belief system
# righteousness, justness; being right in one's cause
# A pledge, contract, promise or oath.
# A fact or truth.

====Descendants====
* {{desc|en|truth}}, {{l|en|troth}}
* {{desc|sco|trowth}}, {{l|sco|trewth}}

====References====
* {{R:MED Online|entry=treuth |pos=n|id=MED47016|accessdate=2018-03-16}}
